title: backhand index pointing down: medium-light skin tone

nouns: One of the long extremities of the hand, sometimes excluding the thumb.
One of the long extremities of the hand that is used for gripping objects.
Any of the terminal members of the hand (sometimes excepting the thumb)
Organ of manipulation and sensation found in the hands of humans and other primates
A finger is a limb of the human body and a type of digit, an organ of manipulation and sensation found in the hands of humans and other primates.
That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
The part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
The zoological term for the distal portion of the forelimb of an animal (including the human hand)
The (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
The manus is the zoological term for the distal portion of the fore limb of an animal.
A hand, as the part of the fore limb below the forearm in a man, or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.
A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered extremity located at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.

description: This version of the  Backhand Index Pointing Down emoji has the  Medium-light Skin Tone applied, which is displayed as a Cream White Ski
apple_vendor_description: Apple's backhand index pointing down emoji, rendered with a medium-light skin tone, features a hand with a cleanly defined index finger extending downwards.  The emoji is crafted with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading and smooth gradients, giving it a polished and tactile appearance.  This directional gesture is commonly used to draw attention to something located below the message, indicating a reference, a link, or simply directing the recipient's gaze downwards.
